segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing in this kitchen drawing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's on full, and the sink is just pouring water over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's right there, drying a plate, completely zoned out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in the puddle, but she hasn't flinched at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there's the boy on the stool, teetering as he grabs cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Whoa, that stool looks ready to flip backward any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's below, hand out like it's the most normal thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar's wide open, full to the brim with treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, everything's so serene in the garden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's shocking how these hazards are all happening unnoticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are dripping now from the overflowâ€”didn't see that coming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This contrast between calm outside and chaos inside is wild.
segments.speaker: PAR
